author: J14T14
title: An Odd Set, but Good For the Time
review:
This LEGO® Basic set was similar to today's Classic sets. It had 33 common bricks that kids could use to build whatever they want.

On the box, there are suggestions of what you could build. There is a frowning boy in a stereotypical Egyptian pose, a 5 leges animal of sorts, an animal that looks like a turtle, and a house that is 9 bricks hig, 2 studs deep, and 12 studs wide. 

The best part of the set is are the classic eye's printed on 2x2 bricks and the smile/ frown 2/4 printed brick. I loved using these as a kid to put faces on my creations.

Overall, this is a good set for the time, but it doesn't hold up today.
